article_title: Irving police investigating after finding body in park
article_text:
This post has been updated.

Irving police said they are investigating after a man in his mid-40s was found dead in a park overnight.

Police responded to a call about someone passed out in Fritz Park a little after midnight, James McLellan, a spokesman for Irving police, said in an email.

Officers searched the park and found a body in the north side of the park, near South Britain Road.

McLellan said there were no visible signs of trauma to the body. He said the medical examiner’s office is trying to identify the man and will determine a cause of death.
